intro: Parasenecio farfarifolius subsp. farfarifolius, commonly known as the farfaraleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or open woodland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturalists alike.
